info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 6:52PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern McDowell, northwestern Rutherford, northeastern Henderson, northwestern Polk and southeastern Buncombe Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 652 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Columbus, or near Lake Lure, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Lure, Chimney Rock Village, Chimney Rock State Park, Bat Cave, Shingle Hollow, Gerton, Edneyville and Lake Adger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
